squats_feedback.right: The initial stance with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and arms crossed helps in maintaining balance and proper squat form. The instruction to shift weight to the ball of the feet and bend the knees ensures a good start into the squat movement. Reaching as close to 90 degrees ensures proper squat depth, maximizing engagement of thighs and glutes. The description of the upward movement and emphasis on posture is correctly noted.
